channel.title: Stop using no-ip
channel.description:
[size=20pt]D O N O T U S E N O - I P A N Y M O R E[/size]
No-ip WILL slow your connection down incredibly, and it's COMPLETELY useless. Any random kid with windows can find your IP adress within 10 seconds by logging into your server...
[img]http://i.gyazo.com/8e1a8cf0250a752f66d97f040063421a.png[/img]
Instead, get DDOS Protection. No-ip is used to cover your IP, your client is jarred, now i know there are people who can simple decompile, which is why, if you want a decent server, you buy DDOS protection.

item.title: Stop using no-ip
item.dc:creator: @djdoyle1 djdoyle1
item.description:
@djdoyle1 wrote:

Hahahahaha this is funny. Pretty sure no-ip was originally used with the DUC for people with dynamic IPs to host nice little wL sources.

“slows down your connection”

Here’s why that isn’t true:

When you register a domain with No-IP an A record (or AAAA if you decide you want to use IPv6) is added to their domain. An A record is cached by either your DNS server or your own computer (in case of Windows or you’re using dnsmasq on Linux). After that initial connection you’re connected directly through the IP of the server (iirc rsps’ are tcp) and every connection to the domain after will be to directly to the IP until the TTL set on the A record.

If you’re on Linux you can use dig to test this. Your first request’s query time will be significantly higher than the second request’s query time.

tl;dr: you’re a spud. also, did you really just use netstat to find the IP of a domain? ping or dig. just saying.

omg u go on runescap thru runescape.com??? u will lag lots u hav to telnet into runescape.com to get the ip then connec thru ip 2 get no lag!

Read full topic

item.title: Stop using no-ip
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

no-ip was never intended to cover your ip… no-ip is used as a cheap (free) domain name service so that if your IP changes you can fix things like web routing or client routing through your no-ip control panel instead of having to go through all the places you hard coded it and changing it there.

unless you have proof it “slows down your connection”, this thread is complete bollocks

EDIT - Pretty much exactly what whattehp406 said

Read full topic

item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“Cres, post:6, topic:549614”][quote author=naseem142 link=topic=668508.msg4470965#msg4470965 date=1422902805]
not sure if sarcastic comments or serious
[/quote][/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Stop using no-ip
item.dc:creator: @whattehp406 whattehp406
item.description:
@whattehp406 wrote:

Does fudgeing nobody on this damn forums know what the fudgeing use of a DDNS service like NO-IP is. It’s not for fudgeing hiding your IP because it can easily be resolved by any web service. No, it’s use is that if you don’t have a static IP you can change the IP that your no-ip url redirects to online without having to re-upload your client.

Furthermore, you’re stupid. NO-IP is a DDNS service and doesn’t slow your connection down whatsoever, your application (client) resolves the IP from their DNS server and connects to that IP, so directly to your server. yes it might slow down your first DNS resolve but whatever that’s not even relevant.

Trying to hide your IP while hosting a server is absolutely stupid, why would you hide your street address to the mailman or amazon!

Read full topic
